channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Over 100,000 attend London rally organized by far-right activist, clashes break out
item.description: The march, organized by far-right activist Tommy Robinson, drew more than 110,000 people on Saturday. At least 26 police officers were injured in clashes that broke out.
item.content:encoded:
The march, organized by far-right activist Tommy Robinson, drew more than 110,000 people on Saturday. At least 26 police officers were injured in clashes that broke out.

(Image credit: Joanna Chan)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump administration launches trial program to fast-track electric air taxis
item.description: The FAA is seeking proposals for projects that will include piloted and unmanned operations with a focus on electric air taxis, also called an electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft.
item.content:encoded:
The FAA is seeking proposals for projects that will include piloted and unmanned operations with a focus on electric air taxis, also called an electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft.

(Image credit: Bebeto Matthews)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Earl Richardson, an educator 'armed with history' and who changed HBCUs, dies
item.description: Richardson, a former president at Baltimore's Morgan State University, led a lawsuit that ended in a historic settlement for four historically Black colleges and universities in Maryland. He was 81.
item.content:encoded:
Richardson, a former president at Baltimore's Morgan State University, led a lawsuit that ended in a historic settlement for four historically Black colleges and universities in Maryland. He was 81.

(Image credit: Morgan State University)
item.dc:creator: Joseph Shapiro

item.title: Israel ramps up strikes on Gaza City and hospital says at least 32 are dead
item.description: The dead included 12 children, according to Shifa Hospital. Israel in recent days has destroyed multiple high-rise buildings and accused Hamas of putting surveillance equipment in them.
item.content:encoded:
The dead included 12 children, according to Shifa Hospital. Israel in recent days has destroyed multiple high-rise buildings and accused Hamas of putting surveillance equipment in them.

(Image credit: Yousef Al Zanoun)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: FAA seeks to fine Boeing $3.1 million for safety violations, door plug blowout
item.description: The FAA said it identified hundreds of quality system violations at Boeing's 737 factory in Renton, Wash., and Boeing subcontractor Spirit AeroSystems' 737 factory in Wichita, Kan.
item.content:encoded:
The FAA said it identified hundreds of quality system violations at Boeing's 737 factory in Renton, Wash., and Boeing subcontractor Spirit AeroSystems' 737 factory in Wichita, Kan.

(Image credit: Lindsey Wasson)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Utah residents are reeling, knowing the Charlie Kirk suspect is one of their own
item.description: "This is everywhere. Every community, every town, every state," one of the suspect's neighbors said. "It's going to be everybody's neighbor, everybody's classmate. It's not at all unusual anymore."
item.content:encoded:
"This is everywhere. Every community, every town, every state," one of the suspect's neighbors said. "It's going to be everybody's neighbor, everybody's classmate. It's not at all unusual anymore."

(Image credit: David Condos)
item.dc:creator: Marisa Pe√±aloza

item.title: Fed's Cook claimed second residence as 'vacation home,' undercutting Trump fraud claims
item.description: Fed Gov. Lisa Cook referred to a condo she bought in 2021 as a "vacation home" in a loan estimate, which could undermine claims by the Trump administration that she committed mortgage fraud.
item.content:encoded:
Fed Gov. Lisa Cook referred to a condo she bought in 2021 as a "vacation home" in a loan estimate, which could undermine claims by the Trump administration that she committed mortgage fraud.

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump tells NATO members they must move first on Russia sanctions over Ukraine
item.description: Trump tells NATO members they need to cut off Russia energy purchases before he will take bigger steps to isolate Russia over its war in Ukraine.
item.content:encoded:
Trump tells NATO members they need to cut off Russia energy purchases before he will take bigger steps to isolate Russia over its war in Ukraine.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Charlie Kirk's widow: 'You have no idea what you have just unleashed'
item.description: Erika Kirk said Charlie Kirk's mission will continue, and thanked law enforcement and President Trump for supporting her family in the aftermath of her husband's death.
item.content:encoded:
Erika Kirk said Charlie Kirk's mission will continue, and thanked law enforcement and President Trump for supporting her family in the aftermath of her husband's death.

(Image credit: Ross D. Franklin)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Opinion: Our backgrounds and beliefs may vary, but we're all American
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon recounts the toll of five years of political violence in the U.S.
item.content:encoded:
NPR's Scott Simon recounts the toll of five years of political violence in the U.S.

(Image credit: Lindsey Wasson)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon
